title: Moment a convenience store owner blasts an AK-47 at an unarmed customer
text:
Footage released yesterday shows a Florida convenience store owner blasting AK-47 rounds at an unarmed customer, leaving him permanently disabled.

Saf Ahmad, owner of Kwik Pic in Lauderhill, was arrested in December 2017 after he shot Jason Morris in the back on Christmas Eve.

Morris can be seen on CCTV gesticulating and berating the store owner before leaving, picking up a trash can and hurling it at the door.

Ahmad then appears alongside an employee, both waving handguns at Morris, who drives around in circles in front of the building. The shop owner then goes inside and rushes back out with his assault rifle.

Saf Ahmad, owner of Kwik Pic in Lauderhill, was arrested in December 2017 after he shot Jason Morris in the back on Christmas Eve (pictured: Ahmad fires off rounds in CCTV footage)

Ahmad, who initially claimed Morris had shot at him first, has since said something was thrown from Morris' car, later identified as a bottle of Castor Oil.

The police say surveillance footage they obtained shows Morris was never in possession of a gun.

Morris told police he had gone to the store to complain about a previous incident, alleging his friend was beaten up outside the building.

Morris also claimed there were nefarious activities going on at the shop and customers had been threatened with violence.

Ahmad's lawyer Andrew Rier is quoted by NBC as saying: 'Mr Ahmad did not provoke a confrontation. The confrontation was brought to him ... He's trying to save lives, not end it.'

At one point Ahmad (left and right) brandishes a handgun at Morris before going back inside to retrieve his assault rifle

Morris is seen berating the store owner in the footage before leaving and hurling a trash can at the door before the violence erupts

Ahmad holds an AK-47 assault rifle on the doorstep to his store on Christmas Eve 2017

Morris admitted to throwing a bottle at the door and that was when Ahmad opened fire.

In a court filing from July, Ahmad's lawyer said his client feared the bottle could have been a grenade.

Ahmad is facing one count of aggravated battery with a deadly weapon.

His next hearing was set for November 1.
description: Saf Ahmad, owner of Kwik Pic in Lauderhill, was arrested in December 2017 after he shot Jason Morris in the back on Christmas Eve.
